results.content:
This is a really great course. It has a nice balance of theory followed by practice and takes you step by step through the concepts.

It was really easy to follow along and understand.

I would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to get an introduction to angular2 and the concepts.

There are a few changes now angular2 rc.1 has just been released but they are not major and fairly easy to adjust and get working with the latest release.
results.content_html:

results.content:
Course is based on an unreleased version of Angular2. Lot of things have changed and no lesson or examples will work as is. Structure of the course is fine, but content should have been updated and kept current with the released version or the course should not be available for purchase. 
For students who are stuck with this course, I have working examples in this course uploaded at this location in github --> https://github.com/psachdev6375/angular2examples
results.content_html:

For students who are stuck with this course, I have working examples in this course uploaded at this location in github --> https://github.com/psachdev6375/angular2examples

results.content: The instructor should slow down and explain more.  For example, some built-in classes and interfaces are imported from angular2/core and others are imported from angular2/common (or other libraries).  How do you know where to import the classes/interfaces from?
results.content_html: The instructor should slow down and explain more. For example, some built-in classes and interfaces are imported from angular2/core and others are imported from angular2/common (or other libraries). How do you know where to import the classes/interfaces from?

results.content: The quality for it's own is better than my rating. The rating is only because Angular 2 had some changes which differ to this course and it take a while fige out what's not working like it is shown in this course. It would be fine, when the author writes notes into the Q&A's what has changed and how to fix it while watching the video.
